metadata.name: Suspicious Browser Child Process - MacOS
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious child processes spawned from browsers. This could be a result of a potential web browser exploitation.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('com.apple.webkit.webcontent')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('firefox')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome helper')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('microsoft edge')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('opera')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('safari')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('tor browser'))) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/curl')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/dash')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ksh')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/osascript')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/perl')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/php')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/pwsh')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/python')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/sh')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/tcsh')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/wget')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/zsh'))) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--defaults-torrc')) OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*/library/application support/microsoft/mau.*/microsoft autoupdate\.app/contents/macos/msupdate.*' OR (contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome helper')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome'))) AND (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*/volumes/google chrome/google chrome\.app/contents/frameworks/.*/resources/install\.sh.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*/applications/google chrome\.app/contents/frameworks/google chrome framework\.framework/.*/resources/keystone_promote_preflight\.sh.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*/applications/google chrome\.app/contents/frameworks/google chrome framework\.framework/.*/resources/keystone_promote_postflight\.sh.*') OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('microsoft edge')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ioplatformexpertdevice')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('hw.model'))) OR (contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome helper')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('google chrome'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/users/')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/library/application support/google/chrome/recovery/')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/chromerecovery'))) AND NOT (process.cmd_line is null OR lower(process.cmd_line) = lower('')))

output.summary: Detects suspicious child processes spawned from browsers. This could be a result of a potential web browser exploitation.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate browser install, update and recovery scripts References: https://fr.slideshare.net/codeblue_jp/cb19-recent-apt-attack-on-crypto-exchange-employees-by-heungsoo-kang, https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules/blob/4312d8c9583be524578a14fe6295c3370b9a9307/rules/macos/execution_initial_access_suspicious_browser_childproc.toml
